channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title:
Breaking News: U.S. forces killed the leader of ISIS, Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi, in a raid in northwest Syria, President Biden said.
Follow our updates. https://t.co/tCwm3hwRd5

Thousands of police officers lined the sides of Fifth Avenue in New York City, standing at attention a dozen rows deep as bagpipe players, police vehicles and emergency trucks accompanied the hearse carrying Officer Wilbert Mora's casket. https://t.co/0AD7PW38e9 https://t.co/pSU7FYuE5m

All seven House Republicans who voted to impeach Donald Trump and are seeking re-election have out-raised their primary opponents, many of whom have received Trump’s backing, according to campaign disclosures filed with the Federal Election Commission. https://t.co/z0Ob4T5DYt

Two years into the pandemic, the coronavirus is killing Americans at far higher rates than people in other wealthy nations.
The ballooning death toll has defied the hopes that the less severe Omicron variant would spare the U.S. the pain of past waves. https://t.co/Ie4YT3jLlI https://t.co/dQNEz06px3

U.S. soldiers who have not yet been vaccinated against the coronavirus will be immediately discharged, the Army said on Wednesday, joining other military branches that have already begun doing so. A vast majority of troops are inoculated, the Army said. https://t.co/z2xy4yHrhP

A senior House Democrat called on Wednesday for the resignation of Louis DeJoy, the postmaster general, saying he flouted President Biden’s plan to electrify the federal fleet by placing a multibillion-dollar order for mostly gasoline-powered vehicles. https://t.co/Qt2ymyq1RH

Amy Schneider's winning streak set a record for women on "Jeopardy!" She also became a fan favorite, and to some, a new transgender icon. @Jeopardamy discusses her life, the show and what’s next with @shaneisland. Join us Wednesday at 5:30 p.m. ET.
https://t.co/S3VB5VYARe

Breaking News: Jeff Zucker resigned as the president of CNN, writing in a memo that he had failed to disclose a romantic relationship with another senior executive at the company. The relationship came up during the network’s investigation into Chris Cuomo.https://t.co/ksaYyL7SwX

“Death rates are so high in the States — eye-wateringly high,” a global public health expert said. Despite having one of the world’s most powerful arsenals of vaccines, the U.S. has failed to inoculate as much of its population as other wealthy nations. https://t.co/wj5vcBTi9w
The U.S. has a far higher Covid death rate than other wealthy nations, reflecting lagging vaccinations and other weaknesses. https://t.co/fM9jkv4vxM

Feral pigs in the San Francisco Bay Area are tearing up lawns, threatening the drinking water and disturbing vineyard harvests. They're part of what one federal official called a "feral swine bomb" — and many people want them dead. https://t.co/smZ4xQ8hi1

Amy Schneider's winning streak set a record for women on "Jeopardy!" She also became a fan favorite, and to some, a new transgender icon. @Jeopardamy discusses her life, the show and what’s next with @shaneisland. Join us Wednesday at 5:30 p.m. ET.
https://t.co/Qf5ZzS4qT5

Breaking News: Tom Brady announced his retirement from the NFL, ending an unparalleled 22-year career with seven Super Bowl titles and three MVP awards. https://t.co/RWWRoil6ZL https://t.co/WxaZ48cZ0q

A long-awaited report on parties in Downing Street during the pandemic dealt Prime Minister Boris Johnson a stinging blow on Monday, condemning him for failed leadership and painting a damning picture of "excessive" workplace drinking. https://t.co/QMQWxWip5g https://t.co/9nXal69hwL

Donald Trump was more involved than previously known in proposals to seize voting machines over baseless claims of election fraud in 2020, new accounts show. The plans explored using national security agencies to take control of the machines. https://t.co/vTXEd15rKi

The photographer Claire Thomas found solace in the picturesque countryside of her homeland in Wales, where herds of wild mountain ponies have roamed freely among the hills for centuries.
See her photos here: https://t.co/LcMNKsnpPz https://t.co/UPYZsF74Km
Breaking News: Donald Trump was more involved than previously known in proposals to seize voting machines over baseless claims of fraud in 2020, new accounts show. https://t.co/kYBJk1PKcZ

Breaking News: Pfizer and its partner BioNTech are expected to ask the FDA as soon as Tuesday to authorize its Covid vaccine for children 6 months to 4 years old as a two-dose regimen. https://t.co/Kok4Ff81cx
The hit game Wordle has been purchased by the New York Times Company for a price "in the low seven figures," the company said. https://t.co/XZhY6kW3mv
Spotify said it would enforce its rules about Covid misinformation and add an advisory, but would not take the position of a “content censor.” https://t.co/LFQIZdDaQ9
Book banning efforts are spreading around American schools at an “unprecedented” pace, shocking educators and free speech advocates. https://t.co/BtWXkreWDH

Donald Trump said in a speech in Texas that if elected to a new term as president, he would consider pardoning those prosecuted for attacking the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6 last year. https://t.co/5xV0vYog6Z

Breaking News: The British government published a long-awaited report on Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s lockdown-breaking parties. It found that Downing Street suffers from a culture of “excessive” workplace drinking that led to the social gatherings. https://t.co/hG4naj7jDK
Lumpia are cousins to spring rolls, and these skinny cigarillos with supercrunchy skins are packed with meat and fried in hot oil. https://t.co/EnGsJ4FUgP https://t.co/5wyUW4XzPh

When Chinese officials isolated the city of Wuhan in the first lockdown, they created high-tech controls to track its society to stop the spread of Covid. Now, the same tools are being used to monitor other risks, like crime and "hostile" political forces. https://t.co/Hdoyxk9Ydz

Gunfire by British soldiers unfolded in Northern Ireland 50 years ago, taking over a dozen lives and later becoming known as Bloody Sunday. As Northern Ireland reflects on the grisly day, symbols of division and hostility still hold their power. https://t.co/4gb0woDhEV https://t.co/WAaVHb2Clf
For the third time in franchise history, the Cincinnati Bengals are in the Super Bowl. https://t.co/AoKishajya

Democrats complained, for much of the last decade, that Republicans and their allies were spending hundreds of millions of difficult-to-trace dollars to influence politics. "Dark money" became a dirty word.
Then came the 2020 election.
https://t.co/kyaCaeq8Dz
You can make pancakes from scratch in about as much time as it takes to make toast 🥞 https://t.co/StjWQ7EMyy https://t.co/Ge1JhNPpZi
Breaking News: Rafael Nadal beat Daniil Medvedev to win a record 21st major title, breaking a tie with Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic. https://t.co/bpXTf0hwuq
With Lunar New Year approaching, now is the time for homemade dumplings. https://t.co/HijNnrkCSh https://t.co/G0kwJtHEPh
If most people started walking 10 extra minutes a day, it could prevent more than 111,000 deaths every year, according to a new study. https://t.co/DEOoTDZZot

This absurdly rich chocolate cake came to The New York Times in 1991 by way of Ebinger’s, the legendary chain of Brooklyn bakeries that closed in 1972 after 74 years in business. https://t.co/CybBNPsQ77
This large, fluffy pancake was first featured in The New York Times for Mardi Gras in 1983. It’s excellent for breakfast, brunch, lunch and dessert. https://t.co/q8AK2nrHDg https://t.co/oeOcoqEYeS

Two nurses on Long Island made more than $1.5 million by selling forged Covid-19 vaccination cards and entering false information into New York’s immunization database, prosecutors said. https://t.co/aLiMZIQfrD

Ashleigh Barty ended a 44-year wait on Saturday, defeating Danielle Collins to become the first Australian player to win the Australian Open singles title since 1978.
Barty defeated Collins in straight sets, 6-3, 7-6 (2).
https://t.co/iPTuOxIzB1 https://t.co/zabJRQzWWN

Joni Mitchell said Friday that she would remove her music from Spotify, joining Neil Young in his protest against the streaming service over its role in giving a platform to Covid-19 vaccine misinformation. https://t.co/kLfzapCyXA

Dr. Johan Hultin, a pathologist whose discovery of victims of the 1918 flu pandemic buried in Alaskan permafrost led to a critical understanding about the virus that caused the outbreak, has died at 97. https://t.co/xsuSnWqPqF

Inside the battle to control Pegasus, the world’s most powerful cyberweapon: A yearlong investigation by @ronenbergman and @MarkMazzettiNYT reveals how Israel used sales of the spyware to advance its interests around the world. https://t.co/hHwLDTpUGT

Joni Mitchell said Friday that she would remove her music from Spotify, joining Neil Young in his protest against the streaming service over its role in giving a platform to Covid-19 vaccine misinformation. https://t.co/XSbkFnPiBl

The conspiracy theory that athletes are collapsing or dying after receiving a Covid-19 vaccine is baseless and there is no evidence to suggest the vaccine is causing more deaths or injuries among athletes. https://t.co/X6CYdNMvnd https://t.co/02exCqJ6V0

The semiautomatic rifle Kyle Rittenhouse used in the fatal shooting of two men and the wounding of another in Kenosha, Wisconsin, will be destroyed under an agreement approved by a judge on Friday. https://t.co/z7G4TbgYu2
Breaking News: The Jan. 6 panel has subpoenaed 14 people who acted as fake electors for Donald Trump in the 2020 election. https://t.co/O8r5XYxFhf

Breaking News: Russia has enough troops at Ukraine’s borders to invade the whole country, the Pentagon said. The U.S. is making plans to cut off Russian banks in the event of an invasion. https://t.co/fhUDNq95Bq

Willow, the plucky farm cat who interrupted a campaign speech by Jill Biden, has officially joined the first family.
“Willow is settling into the White House with her favorite toys, treats and plenty of room to smell and explore,” a spokesman said. https://t.co/tiY328qwsR

Senator Mitch McConnell, the Republican leader who engineered a blockade of Barack Obama's Supreme Court nominee in 2016, warned President Biden on Thursday to “not outsource this important decision to the radical left.” https://t.co/iUPdpyMsDj

Willow, the plucky farm cat who interrupted a campaign speech by Jill Biden, has officially joined the first family.
“Willow is settling into the White House with her favorite toys, treats and plenty of room to smell and explore,” a spokesman said. https://t.co/TEW3l6Q5Ev https://t.co/ekppf8J67O

Two days after Sarah Palin tested positive for the coronavirus, the former Alaska governor dined outdoors in New York City on Wednesday evening, defying federal guidance that infected people isolate from others for at least five full days. https://t.co/GKErs4is7I

President Biden commended Justice Stephen Breyer for his nearly 28 years on the bench, and said his pick for the vacancy “will be the first Black woman ever nominated to the United States Supreme Court.” https://t.co/w3P0pYWUGx https://t.co/FwGRSss2JU
Breaking News: A federal judge revoked Gulf of Mexico oil and gas leases, ruling the Biden administration failed to consider climate change when it sold them. https://t.co/CKlDczpgAx
